title: aoluain
author: aoluain
content: Hi all, I think/hope this is the correct board to post this inMy son is a few months in to a UI UX design course online and wants some related BOOKSfor Christmas but we have no idea what to get.A bit of background: he has been working in Data Analytics for a few years and wants to addUI UX Design to the portfolio.My first thoughts on this would be that the area is a fast moving one and that somebookswould become obsolete fairly quickly I could be wrong though.I guess there are a lot of designers in this board so hopefully you have some suggestions.any input is much appreciated.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: aoluain on December 02, 2022, 12:59:37 PMA bit of background: he has been working in Data Analytics for a few years and wants to addUI UX Design to the portfolio.Your son needs to do some Google search. These days who could be better than a search engine? ðŸ˜‰https://userguiding.com/blog/best-ux-design-books/https://www.eleken.co/blog-posts/ui-ux-bookshttps://www.creative-tim.com/blog/educational-ui-ux/best-web-design-books/https://www.uxdesigninstitute.com/blog/must-read-books-for-ux-designers/There are many to start but from above references you should be able to select one or two for him.P.S: I am wondering how old is your son?

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Thanks for the links, yes it's easy to do an online search but I was hoping to get somesuggestions from UI UX designers here on the forum.I see from those 4 links the first recommendation from 3 of the sites is a "general" designbook - 1. The Design of Everyday Things by Don Norman are they just copying eachother or is that book really the "Bible" of design?
